advertisement

A charged crowd filled Eisenhower Auditorium last night anticipating the lecture by Alice Walker whose softspoken voice hushed the audience from the moment she began speaking PERIOD

Walker author of The Color Purple spoke to Penn State students professors and book lovers as a part of the Distinguished Speaker Series PERIOD

She spoke of her past and her inspirations for writing especially poetry PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD

Walker shared six of her poems with the audience including a poem that she hoped would become a childrens book 

 Walker said PERIOD 

 Walker said PERIOD 

Touching on the topic of healing Walker said that all of humankind is amazing because of the way people learn to heal PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD

Walker briefly discussed her experience in college with working multiple jobs and writing while she was working PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD 

As  approached a man stood up to announce the question and answer portion of the evening PERIOD However he was unhappily greeted by Walker who said slightly sarcastically 

During the question and answer segment a woman who had seen Walker speak ten years ago said that she did not think Walkers lecture had included any new material she had not heard PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD The woman feeling misunderstood attempted to explain herself again when Walker finished speaking PERIOD

The last question asked Walker for her opinion on what students especially those graduating should do to find their way in life PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD 

One attendee said she was excited to hear Walkers inspirational speech PERIOD

 said Emily Yost a Maryland resident who traveled to see Walker speak PERIOD
